text: Charles Gain (November 1, 1923 – August 21, 2018) was an American police official. He was born in Hanford, California. He first was police chief for Oakland, California, then as chief in San Francisco in the 1970s. In 1975, Gain was appointed to run the San Francisco Police Department by Mayor George Moscone and was until 1980. Gain died from respiratory failure in San Francisco on August 21, 2018 at the age of 94.Charles Gain, controversial S.F. police chief during turbulent ‘70s, dies ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:Disease-related deaths in San Francisco Category:American police officers Category:People from San Francisco Category:People from Oakland, California
title: Charles Gain
